column1: Today our hearts break for the Duvall family. After her courageous fight with cancer Bonnie wife of American Farm Bureau President Zippy Duvall and mother of my former staffer Zellie has passed. Please join Robin and me in praying for this amazing family.
Take a look at my e-newsletter to see what I did this week in Washington → https://t.co/fvuz8Wx49Q https://t.co/MZcMcZzUCP

Last night I spoke during a #prolife special order on the House floor recognizing the 47th Anniversary of Roe v. Wade. Every human life from the moment of conception is precious and worthy of dignity and respect. https://t.co/qVHKk1VEGg

Our Founding Fathers enshrined religious freedom in the First Amendment to our Constitution and we must diligently guard this right. On #ReligiousFreedomDay we celebrate the many faiths in America & remember those around the world who face persecution for professing their faith. https://t.co/Rf62vUq1JT

I held a telephone town hall Tuesday night to answer questions from residents of #GA12. I gave an update on Democrats' impeachment charade #USMCA Iran and more. Here are some highlights: https://t.co/1rdOzqX34C https://t.co/wRl81Kadfc
As we raise awareness this month we must come together to discuss ways to end this heinous crime.

Human trafficking is a form of modern slavery that knows no bounds and impacts millions around the world – including our communities in Georgia. I am proud to support legislation and funding to fight human trafficking both at home and abroad. https://t.co/zi2KynXcSI
Take a look at my e-newsletter to see what I did this week in Washington → https://t.co/wgl8RyqZNw https://t.co/xfUXLaz8uf

The House just passed a partisan resolution aimed at weakening President Trump at a moment our nation should be steadfast & united. Earlier today I spoke on the House floor about the ongoing situation with Iran and commended @realDonaldTrump for protecting American lives. https://t.co/1QCtzZmHqv
Thank you to the men and women serving in law enforcement who put themselves in harm’s way in order to keep our communities safe. Happy Law Enforcement Appreciation Day! https://t.co/NM8JXjY94H

Robin and I were thrilled to take the inaugural flight from Augusta Regional Airport to our nation’s capital. This direct flight will be a huge asset to our booming industries in #GA12 work at Savannah River Site service members at Fort Gordon and growing cyber community. https://t.co/zoBbwEuC09
Praying for our U.S service members and partners in the region. Americans must come together to fight against terrorism and those who wish us harm. https://t.co/GotkcF7ghQ
Congratulations @SenatorLoeffler! Looking forward to working together on behalf of Georgians. https://t.co/EpZorkTWXw
Did you know on this day in 1788 Georgia was the 4th state to join the union? Happy birthday to the Peach State! https://t.co/aNJkvb7XTh
Happy New Year! Robin and I wish you all a blessed 2020. https://t.co/j3ZR0WYVdO
Congressman Lewis is not afraid of a challenge and I have no doubt he will face his diagnosis with courage and strength. Robin and I are praying for our fellow Georgian. https://t.co/Qs7OEuHItQ

Robin and I enjoyed visiting @GAChildrens and the @GACancerCenter at @AUG_University with President Dr. Brooks Keel and Senator-designate Kelly Loeffler. During our visit we were able to hand out blankets and wish some of the patients Happy Holidays. https://t.co/ZaL11qrb50
As we celebrate the birth of our Savior Jesus Christ today I hope your day is merry and blessed. From my family to yours Merry Christmas and Happy New Year! https://t.co/PCPQZl7kQl

I am so proud of all that my office was able to accomplish on behalf of #GA12 in 2019! If we can ever be of assistance please reach out to any of my offices: https://t.co/BkdQMrn2mA https://t.co/Ofa8fWdsww
Wishing a Happy Hanukkah and joy-filled celebration to my friends in #GA12 and all those celebrating around the world. https://t.co/zJQjG6PRPU

More great news for #GA12! https://t.co/dKOULUAZnd

For the past year we have warned House Democrats of the urgency of getting this done and while I am disappointed it took so long I am proud that today we were finally able to deliver this long overdue win for the American people. My full statement on #USMCA ⬇️ https://t.co/Irt3MKD1ur

I just voted NO on both articles of impeachment. Earlier today I spoke during debate against this partisan impeachment sham. The Democrats want Americans to believe that President Trump is guilty until he proves himself innocent. This whole process is unconstitutional. https://t.co/4j0ks0m5VL

Quick reminder before today’s #impeachment vote: Democrats have not brought forward any evidence of a high crime or misdemeanor. This is a one-sided political charade. I will vote NO on both articles of impeachment. https://t.co/IoCKAJFxoY
...simply because one political party doesn’t like our duly elected President.  I will continue to stand with President Donald Trump and the American people.

Speaker Pelosi said it best in March when she said impeachment is ‘so divisive to the country’ that it must be ‘compelling overwhelming and bipartisan.’ It’s a shame she has changed her tune and is willing to divide our country...
I will vote no on both articles of impeachment. House Democrats have not brought forward any evidence of an impeachable offense. This vote is shameful and sets a dangerous precedent.

Long before the phone call with Ukraine took place liberals made their intent to undermine President @realDonaldTrump clear. This week in a desperate attempt to solidify the last few months Speaker Pelosi will bring two articles of impeachment to the House floor for a vote.
Congratulations to @dcsirish and the Fighting Irish football team on winning the State Championship! https://t.co/DAnRSJQH5M
Take a look at my e-newsletter to see what I did this week in Washington → https://t.co/5ZRll5oR8C https://t.co/P2qcYULcAy

The promise of future life-saving cures is facing its greatest threat the #FewerCures and More Government Price Control Act. Speaker Pelosi is trying to jam her radical prescription drug plan through the legislative process. Read my @AUG_Chronicle op-ed⬇️ https://t.co/VaEXs0kbhV

It authorizes $738 billion in defense funding provides the largest pay raise for our armed forces in a decade and rejects numerous Democrat poison pills – such as restrictions on President Trump’s authorities to secure our borders. My full statement: https://t.co/BRDspEBEYh 2/2
Today I proudly supported the FY20 #NDAA. This legislation secures vital funds to support the men and women who selflessly serve our great country in uniform. 1/2

Yesterday House Democrat leadership unveiled articles of impeachment despite no evidence to prove their case. They've been trying to undermine President Trump since day one so it’s no surprise their charade is growing more unpopular – even among Dems. https://t.co/ds0I2q6grx

Today I joined 158 of my colleagues demanding Speaker Pelosi bring #USMCA to a vote. It's been over a year since @POTUS signed it and it would be a huge win for the American people. https://t.co/oEjVUsg0T4

78 years ago today our nation was attacked at Pearl Harbor- a date that lives in infamy. We honor the fallen those who were trapped in ships and those who were brave and fought back. https://t.co/cnvNkz53V0
Take a look at my e-newsletter to see what I did this week in Washington → https://t.co/AD5z216zza https://t.co/CebgVhWHQW

Yesterday with bipartisan support the House of Representatives passed the TRACED Act legislation that aims to end the malicious practice of robocalls and spoofing. I spoke in support of this bill during debate on the House floor ⬇️ https://t.co/CGwJV4hhoU

As a businessman I am proud of providing families with the dignity and respect that comes with a good job—and this rule upholds that ideal and the intent of government assistance by helping only those truly in need. More info on the rule: https://t.co/TGGjCi7FHF 2/2

Today USDA announced a final rule to promote work among recipients of SNAP who are able-bodied without dependents. The 2018 Farm Bill that I worked on and was ultimately passed in the 115th Congress laid the groundwork for this monumental action. 1/2

Robin and I were thrilled to join @redcross this holiday season to write letters to our service members in the U.S. and overseas. We are grateful for their service and sacrifice! #HolidayMailforHeroes https://t.co/gkI8fyjpGn

The deadline for farmers & ranchers whose commodities have been directly impacted by foreign retaliatory tariffs to sign up for USDA’s Market Facilitation Program is this Friday Dec. 6. For more info and to sign up visit: https://t.co/ip5C2Zr5dm or contact your local FSA.

As I take some time to reflect today on life’s many blessings there is so much to be thankful for including family friends our freedom in this country and the honor of serving #GA12. From our family to yours Happy Thanksgiving! https://t.co/SPDGcAgjWF
Thank you to all our #GA12 farmers who work every day to feed us. I appreciate the Laurens County Farm Bureau for inviting me to the Farmer Appreciation Lunch this week. https://t.co/HW4av0iLY1

It’s been nearly 2 months since Speaker Pelosi Adam Schiff & House Dems announced their partisan #impeachment sham. That’s 2 months we could have spent focusing on #USMCA securing our border and lowering prescription drug prices – delivering results for the American people. https://t.co/KCqM1IxcFq

.@SenatorIsakson is a Georgia legend and will be deeply missed. Robin and I enjoyed celebrating him last night with some of my Georgia colleagues after our special order on the House floor → https://t.co/DcbS1QSDvI https://t.co/9XPO3khCEF
Great news for #GA12! https://t.co/TDcELPTKwK

Yesterday I spoke on the House floor in support of #NationalApprenticeshipWeek. By connecting employers directly to their future workforce Americans have the opportunity to develop technical skills while gaining valuable work experience. https://t.co/uO6DHuvt8m
Meanwhile Congress has a funding deadline next week and we have yet to hear anything from Democrats on how they plan to fund the government!

Today’s public impeachment hearings are all for show. This has been a partisan investigation since day one and none of the Democrats’ witnesses have any firsthand knowledge of President Trump’s objectives with Ukraine. https://t.co/Eu2a8IGp2m

It’s been almost a year since @realDonaldTrump signed the USMCA but Speaker Pelosi still won’t scheduled a vote. We must pass the #USMCANow to create more jobs boost wages and further grow the economy. https://t.co/aYL0M7BRJu

Nuclear energy provides #GA12 and our country with economic national and environmental security.  I toured Plant Vogtle in Waynesboro and Plant Hatch in Baxley - Units 3 and 4 at Plant Vogtle are the first new nuclear reactors to be built in the U.S. in 30+ years! #gopHEAT https://t.co/mBPex6O0Zq
Thank you to @FarmBureau for serving as a voice for farmers and ranchers in #GA12 and throughout America for the last 100 years. Wishing you a happy birthday! #AFB100

Today and every day we thank the men and women who have served our country in uniform. We will always remember your courage and sacrifice to keep America safe. Without our veterans we would not be the country that we are today. Happy Veterans Day! https://t.co/wOnQyXsSYs

Today Speaker Pelosi and House Democrats passed a partisan impeachment resolution in a desperate attempt to legitimize their secretive closed-door process. I will not stop fighting against this impeachment sham.
It’s an especially scary Halloween when a major political party tries to remove a duly elected President simply because they do not like him.

Chairman Scott not only wouldn’t support my amendment he used this opportunity to rail against the tax cuts passed last Congress that have benefited hard-working Americans. He said he would refer this to the Ways & Means Committee which has jurisdiction over raising taxes. 3/3 https://t.co/XSGWf9TaZD
The Democrats want to reward criminal behavior rather than be fair to American taxpayers and legal immigrants. 2/3

Today at the House Education and Labor Committee I offered an amendment to Democrats’ College #unAffordability Act that would prohibit institutions of higher education from offering in-state tuition to illegal immigrants 1/3

Rep. Allen is still down there and will not leave the SCIF until there are answers. While House Democrat leadership continues to withhold information and pursue a closed-door process Rep. Allen will not stop fighting until this impeachment sham is over. 3/3
